title: Self-Intersection of Exotic Weil Classes and Field Discriminants: The Formula deg(w₀ · w₀) = √disc(F) for CM Abelian Fourfolds (Paper 56, Constructive Reverse Mathematics and Arithmetic Geometry Series)
description:
Paper 56 of the Constructive Reverse Mathematics and Arithmetic Geometry series. We compute the self-intersection degree deg(w0 · w0) = √disc(F) for exotic Weil classes on three CM abelian fourfolds of Weil type, providing explicit numerical evidence at the boundary of the Deligne–Poisson–Tate (DPT) conjecture.

Example 1 (K = Q(√-3), F = Q(ζ7 + ζ7-1)): disc(F) = 49, deg = 7.
Example 2 (K = Q(i), F = Q(ζ9 + ζ9-1)): disc(F) = 81, deg = 9.
Example 3 (K = Q(√-7)): disc(F) = 169, deg = 13.

All degrees are positive (Hodge–Riemann), all exotic Weil classes are algebraic (Schoen). The discriminant equation det(G) = disc(F) is exact, established via the cyclic conductor theorem. The 3×3 determinants are computed by native_decide.

The Lean 4 / Mathlib formalization comprises 9 active modules + 2 deprecated (~1,666 lines total, ~1,331 active), compiles with zero errors, zero warnings, and zero sorry gaps. 10 principled axioms encode published results (Milne, Shimura, Schoen). Correction history: v2 (conductor-based) is current; v1/v3 discriminant equation deprecated.

Code is distributed exclusively via this Zenodo record.
